snippet: Evidence recently discovered by an investigator for prosecutors suggests that different people were responsible for murdering a livery-cab driver seventen years ago in the Bronx.
abstract: Lawyers for Eric Glisson and Cathy Watkins, two of five people now believed to have been wrongfully convicted in the 1995 murder of a livery cab driver in the Bronx, cite new evidence in the case and ask the State Supreme Court in the Bronx to vacate their convictions and dismiss charges against them.
lead_paragraph: Evidence recently discovered by an investigator for prosecutors suggests that different people were responsible for murdering a livery-cab driver seventen years ago in the Bronx.

headline.seo: 2 in Cabdriver’s 1995 Murder Ask Court to Vacate Convictions
headline.main: Court Asked to Nullify Convictions in ’95 Killing
headline.print_headline: Court Asked To Nullify Convictions In ’95 Killing
